Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance
headline: Learn everything you need to know about garden design and maintenance with this free online diploma course.
description: This diploma course trains you as a professional gardener and covers everything you need from the planning stage right through to garden maintenance. We show you how to evaluate, plan, purchase, plant and maintain a garden to suit its character and the natural environment. Whether you want to work on your own property or intend to landscape professionally, this course provides the skills required to make the most of the natural beauty around you.

courseDescription:
This diploma course teaches you how to design, create and maintain a garden. We begin with an overview of basic gardening skills like choosing the right tools and plants, preparing the soil, garden maintenance and pest control. We then go through the process of designing a garden, from initial surveying to planning to successful implementation taking into account different styles to choose from and understanding the various uses of the garden, from children playing to being dog friendly.

We then explain how to build a garden’s features like raised flower beds, decks and patios. We examine the ideal dimensions and materials needed before providing step-by-step instructions to help you make your creative vision a reality. The final part of the course focuses on how to establish and run your own gardening business. We examine factors like marketing, social media branding, customer service and to make sure your new business flourishes.

This diploma course polishes your gardening skills to use at home or as part of a thriving gardening and landscaping business. We provide the valuable practical skills you need to sculpt natural beauty into something even more eye-catching.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn the basics of gardening, from the planning stage to maintenance. This will enable you to evaluate, plan, purchase, plant and maintain a garden to suit the natural environment and garden characteristics.
topics: A Typical Day for a Gardener
Month by Month Jobs in the Garden

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn how to select equipment you will need to maintain a garden. In addition, you will learn about racks and stakes for vine plants and how the different kinds of watering systems work.
topics: Choosing the Right Tools for the Garden
Racks and Stakes for Vine Plants

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn all about the primary types of soil and how to identify them in gardens all around the UK. You will also learn about the different qualities of soils any garden can have, what needs to be done to enhance the soil and what works best with each soil type.
topics: Secrets of Great Soil - Learning Outcomes
Other Ways of Classifying British Soils
Secrets of Great Soil - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn, in addition to the soil type and moisture content, about other different aspects to take into consideration before embarking on selecting plants for a garden plot.
topics: Plant Selection and Care - Learning Outcomes
Plant Selection and Care - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about plant reproductive systems, plant physiology, and plant classification. You will also learn the importance of matching certain plants together, how to grow exotic and tropical plants in temperate climates and why native plants are a better choice.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module provides tips on how to lower garden maintenance based on the type of plants and landscape of the garden.
topics: Low Maintenance Gardens and Planting - Learning Outcomes
How to Identify High Maintenance Areas
Using Different Features for Low Maintenance
Planting Fewer Varieties, But More in Numbers
Low Maintenance Gardens and Planting - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will explore aspects of maintaining a garden including pruning and deadheading, natural pest control, whether to fertilizer or not, and winterization in a temperate climate.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will explain several aspects of building a sustainable garden as an owner or as a gardener working for clients. These include using native plants, garden recycling, and water conservation.
topics: Reusing and Recycling Materials in the Garden

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn to identify garden pests and to protect your garden from them in order to have a garden that not only looks amazing, but also produces the most beautiful plants and succulent produce.
topics: Treatment Action Plan: Using Multiple Methods

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will focus on looking at the common difficulties that gardeners often face, as well as the solutions to these problems. Though it is up to the gardener to make the final decision on what to do in these cases, the following module should help you improve the difficulty of gardening.
topics: Solutions to Difficult Gardens - Learning Outcomes
Adding New Plants to Your Garden
Starting Over with the Entire Garden
Other Garden Issues and How to Fix Them
Solutions to Difficult Gardens - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will focus on learning how to grow your own produce and how to care for it once the harvest is over.
topics: Vegetable and Herb Gardens - Learning Outcomes
What to Plant in Vegetable and Herb Gardens
How to Plant Vegetable and Herb Gardens
Vegetable and Herb Gardens - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will become familiar with several aspects of the garden design planning process. You will also learn the process of developing a customized garden design.
topics: Site Survey and Garden Concept Designs
Consideration of the Basic Elements of Garden Design

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explores the potential opportunities and challenges that each garden presents. You will also learn about the many types of garden design styles and themes available to enable you to offer an appropriate design to your client.
topics: Creating a Garden Design Theme or Style
Create a Garden Design Ideas Mood Board

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Survey, Site Appraisal and Measuring Techniques
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the requirements and legalities of site surveys, materials required and main areas and methods of measurement.
topics: Survey, Site Appraisal & Measuring Techniques - Learning Outcomes
What Is a Site Survey and Appraisal?
Types of Measurements Used for Garden Surveying
Scales Used in Site Survey Maps
Recording the Site Information on Paper
How to Measure a Busy Garden
Safety Considerations of Site Survey Maps
Survey, Site Appraisal & Measuring Techniques - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn the important steps involved in planning your garden projects. The plan will safeguard against wasting time, effort and finances.
topics: Extra Tips for Meeting Your Planning Goals

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Proportion Illusions and Effective Use of Space
modules.description: This module covers tricks, techniques and gardening ideas to ensure you can truly optimize the amount of available space in a garden.
topics: Proportion Illusions and Effective Use of Space  - Learning Outcomes
Use Long Straight Lines to Create Illusion of Size
Create a Focal Point of Attraction
Use Garden Features on Walls Instead of Ground
Be Alert for Space Saving Options
Proportion Illusions and Effective Use of Space - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Drawing a Plan and Graphics Skills
modules.description: In this module you will discover the advantages of creating a garden layout plan that incorporates existing features and desired changes to ensure the best choices are made for each garden plot, saving time, money and energy.
topics: Drawing a Plan and Graphics Skills  - Learning Outcomes
Why Create a Garden Layout Plan?
How to Create a Garden Layout Plan
Creating a Scale for the Plan
How to Create a Garden Plan Graphic
Garden Design Ideas for Completing Your Plan
Drawing a Plan and Graphics Skills - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module discusses the different considerations, options, advantages, and types of hard surface landscaping materials.
topics: Surfaces, Materials and Hard Landscaping  - Learning Outcomes
Considerations for Garden Landscape Surfaces and Materials
Surface and Materials Used for Hard Landscaping
Advantages of Combining Different Hard Landscaping Surface Materials
Surfaces, Materials, and Hard Landscaping - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance - First Assessment
modules.description: Test your knowledge of the first half of the course.
topics: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.details: How to Build Raised Flower Beds
modules.description: This module will teach you about raised beds, their benefits, utility and how to construct them. This includes materials needed, ideal dimensions and step-by-step directions.
topics: How to Build Raised Flower Beds  - Learning Outcomes
What Material Can You Use to Build a Raised Bed?
What Is the Ideal Dimension For a Raised Bed?
How to Build the Raised Bed
How to Build Raised Flower Beds - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn what a patio is, it's ideal size, and what materials can be used to build it. You will also learn about things to consider while planning and laying a patio, and the step-by-step procedure to follow in laying a patio.
topics: How to Lay a Patio  - Learning Outcomes
What should you Lay it with?
How to Lay a Patio - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn the advantages of a deck, it's ideal size, and what materials can be used to build it. You will also learn about things to consider while planning and building it, and the step-by-step procedure to follow in building a deck.
topics: A List of Tools you will Need

modules.name: Module
modules.details: How to Put Up Garden Fencing
modules.description: In this module you will learn the importance of fencing, factors to consider while deciding upon a fence type, and choosing the best option. You will also learn the types of fences available, material and tools required and the step-by-step procedure to follow in putting up the fence.
topics: How to Put Up Garden Fencing - Learning Outcomes
Building a Vinyl Coated Welded Wire Fence with T Posts
How to Put Up Garden Fencing - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: How to Turf a Garden and Lay a Lawn
modules.description: In this module you will learn how to turf a garden and lay a lawn, a skill that every gardener must have. This skill includes learning ways to create a lawn, choosing the right grass or turf for the lawn, preparing the soil for turf, laying the turf, and taking care of the turf to establish the lawn.
topics: How to Turf a Garden and Lay a Lawn - Learning Outcomes
How to Turf a Garden and Lay a Lawn - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: How to Lay Artificial Grass Areas
modules.description: In this module you will learn how to lay artificial turf or grass over an area. You will understand the need for artificial turf, the types of turf available, calculation of cost and material, material and tools required and the step-by-step procedure to follow in laying it.
topics: How to Lay Artificial Grass Areas - Learning Outcomes
How to Lay Artificial Grass Areas - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: How to Build a Garden Pond
modules.description: In this module you will learn how to build a garden pond. This includes how to select the right site and pond lining, the pod size, material and tools required and the step-by-step procedure to follow when building it.
topics: How to Build a Garden Pond - Learning Outcomes
Choose a Lining for your Pond
How to Build a Garden Pond - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module focuses on how to establish and run your own gardening business. Factors such as staff skills, website presence, workload, customer service, and overall quality are presented and explained.
topics: Running Your Own Gardening Business - Learning Outcomes
Focus on Building a Website Presence
Making Good on Deliveries and Gardening Jobs
Factors to Keep in Mind While Pricing your Gardening Services
Providing High Quality Work and Plants
Running Your Own Gardening Business - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module examines marketing and social media necessary to advertise your business appropriately. This includes website business marketing, networking, other social media tools and advertising.
topics: Marketing and Social Media - Learning Outcomes
An Introduction to Marketing and Advertising
Understanding Advertising Laws in the UK
The Art of Getting Repeat Business
Marketing and Social Media - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module provides health and safety information necessary to run a proper gardening business. It can also be used by the home gardener.
topics: Health and Safety for the Home Gardener

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Insurance, Tax, VAT and Record Keeping
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the various financial and legal aspects of running a gardening business. This will include an examination of the types of insurance you should have, including information about taxes and accountancy.
topics: Insurance, Tax and Record Keeping - Learning Outcomes
Self Employment or Other Business Taxes
Insurance, Tax and Record Keeping - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance - Second Assessment
modules.description: Test your knowledge of the second half of the course.
topics: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance - Second Assessment

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Garden Design and Maintenance - Final Assessment

slides:
• Gardening Basics

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Describe the different types of natural soil and additional plant mixtures which can be used to stimulate plant growth
    • Discuss plant types and their uses, and discover plant purchasing techniques
    • List the different materials essential for the nourishment of soil to facilitate growing and maintenance of healthy plants
    • Name the required gardening tools and learn about the prevention, detection, and treatment of potential dangers such as pests and disease in plants 

  • Gardening Basics


  • Before deciding what to grow in a garden you must first determine the conditions you have to work with.

    Once you assess the soil, irrigation and other factors, you can then choose the plants, shrubs and flowers that are best suited to the environment, thus saving you time, effort and cost.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • In addition to the type of soil it is important to take into consideration drainage, the amount of light the garden receives and the weather conditions, for example, is the site sheltered, sunny or particularly cold

    Each garden has its own unique qualities and characteristics, which work together to determine the type of plants that will grow successfully. The basis of good gardening is the ability to understand each garden’s distinctive conditions.

  • Gardening Basics


  • Before deciding what to grow in a garden you must first determine the conditions you have to work with.

    Once you assess the soil, irrigation and other factors, you can then choose the plants, shrubs and flowers that are best suited to the environment, thus saving you time, effort and cost.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • In addition to the type of soil it is important to take into consideration drainage, the amount of light the garden receives and the weather conditions, for example, is the site sheltered, sunny or particularly cold

    Each garden has its own unique qualities and characteristics, which work together to determine the type of plants that will grow successfully. The basis of good gardening is the ability to understand each garden’s distinctive conditions.

  • Gardening Basics


  • Before deciding what to grow in a garden you must first determine the conditions you have to work with.

    Once you assess the soil, irrigation and other factors, you can then choose the plants, shrubs and flowers that are best suited to the environment, thus saving you time, effort and cost.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • In addition to the type of soil it is important to take into consideration drainage, the amount of light the garden receives and the weather conditions, for example, is the site sheltered, sunny or particularly cold

    Each garden has its own unique qualities and characteristics, which work together to determine the type of plants that will grow successfully. The basis of good gardening is the ability to understand each garden’s distinctive conditions.

  • Soil Evaluation

  • Soil consists of organic matter, clay, sand and silt.

    The soil provides a home for the roots of each plant to source much needed nutrients and water. There are two layers of soil; the topsoil and the deeper layer of natural earth below.

    Once you dig down one or two feet into the visible top layer you will discover either clay, sandy or a chalky layer. The differences are important to note; clay subsoil is prone to water logging and sandy or chalky subsoil layers can dehydrate in summer months.

    The first step is to carry out a soil evaluation which provides you with essential analysis, so you know what is required to improve it.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • The Different Types of Soils:
    • Clay
    • Peat
    • Chalk
    • Sand
    • Silt
    • Loam

  • Soil Evaluation

  • Soil consists of organic matter, clay, sand and silt.

    The soil provides a home for the roots of each plant to source much needed nutrients and water. There are two layers of soil; the topsoil and the deeper layer of natural earth below.

    Once you dig down one or two feet into the visible top layer you will discover either clay, sandy or a chalky layer. The differences are important to note; clay subsoil is prone to water logging and sandy or chalky subsoil layers can dehydrate in summer months.

    The first step is to carry out a soil evaluation which provides you with essential analysis, so you know what is required to improve it.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • The Different Types of Soils:
    • Clay
    • Peat
    • Chalk
    • Sand
    • Silt
    • Loam

  • Soil Improvement

  • As most soils do not provide an ideal fertile base for sowing, one of the most important tasks within gardening is to therefore create healthy fruitful soil; namely rich in nutrients and organic matter, and with good draining in place.

    This is achieved by adding organic materials such as rotten leaves, peat moss, organic compost and improving the drainage.

    You can improve all types of soil by creating a custom blend, perfect for growing.
  • The following potting mixes are used:

    • All-Purpose: Peat moss, vermiculite and composted bark. This is effective for the majority of plants.
    • Cacti and Succulent: Sand, perlite and potting soil mixed equally provide adequate drainage.
    • Premium: Perlite, composted manure, vermiculite and peat moss is excellent for all soils.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Soil Improvement

  • As most soils do not provide an ideal fertile base for sowing, one of the most important tasks within gardening is to therefore create healthy fruitful soil; namely rich in nutrients and organic matter, and with good draining in place.

    This is achieved by adding organic materials such as rotten leaves, peat moss, organic compost and improving the drainage.

    You can improve all types of soil by creating a custom blend, perfect for growing.
  • The following potting mixes are used:

    • All-Purpose: Peat moss, vermiculite and composted bark. This is effective for the majority of plants.
    • Cacti and Succulent: Sand, perlite and potting soil mixed equally provide adequate drainage.
    • Premium: Perlite, composted manure, vermiculite and peat moss is excellent for all soils.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Garden Preparation and Planning

  • This is a crucial aspect of successful gardening and requires quite a lot of work.

    The soil must be prepared and cultivated to lay a solid and fertile foundation. This loosening of soil becomes easier, once carried out annually before planting, as you systemically alter the soil organically.

    Work with the soil when it is damp or dry but never when wet. It is important to take care not to compact the soil by walking on the beds.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Before planting a single bulb or seed, ensure that you have created an adequate plan on paper. Determine the size of the area to be planted and the number of plants required. Investigate which plants work best with the natural soil, drainage, available sun and shade in the garden and plan accordingly. Group plants together which have similar requirements of light, soil and water.

  • Garden Preparation and Planning

  • This is a crucial aspect of successful gardening and requires quite a lot of work.

    The soil must be prepared and cultivated to lay a solid and fertile foundation. This loosening of soil becomes easier, once carried out annually before planting, as you systemically alter the soil organically.

    Work with the soil when it is damp or dry but never when wet. It is important to take care not to compact the soil by walking on the beds.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Before planting a single bulb or seed, ensure that you have created an adequate plan on paper. Determine the size of the area to be planted and the number of plants required. Investigate which plants work best with the natural soil, drainage, available sun and shade in the garden and plan accordingly. Group plants together which have similar requirements of light, soil and water.

  • Plant Purchase

  • To avoid disappointment, follow these steps when purchasing plants for your projects:

    • Choosing healthy plants before you set them gives the garden a greater chance of success. Choose healthy and vigorous plants, which have multiple buds rather than flowers already in bloom.
    • Know the difference life spans of the plants.
    • Inspect the soil of the plant and under the leaves for signs of insects.
    • Leave behind any plants which show signs of withering, diseased leaves or that appear soggy.
    • Read the plant labels for the plant’s requirements and mature size. If tags are not visible, ask the sales staff to provide a background.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    • Know the hardiness level of your plant and suit it to the climate and garden conditions.
    • Examine the roots of each plant; choose those with pale, smooth, untangled roots which are not growing out the bottom of the plant pot.
    • Think about the colour plan for the garden before choosing plants; using a single colour palette works very well. Decide on the various leaf tones which you may mix in with the given green.

  • Plant Purchase

  • To avoid disappointment, follow these steps when purchasing plants for your projects:

    • Choosing healthy plants before you set them gives the garden a greater chance of success. Choose healthy and vigorous plants, which have multiple buds rather than flowers already in bloom.
    • Know the difference life spans of the plants.
    • Inspect the soil of the plant and under the leaves for signs of insects.
    • Leave behind any plants which show signs of withering, diseased leaves or that appear soggy.
    • Read the plant labels for the plant’s requirements and mature size. If tags are not visible, ask the sales staff to provide a background.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    • Know the hardiness level of your plant and suit it to the climate and garden conditions.
    • Examine the roots of each plant; choose those with pale, smooth, untangled roots which are not growing out the bottom of the plant pot.
    • Think about the colour plan for the garden before choosing plants; using a single colour palette works very well. Decide on the various leaf tones which you may mix in with the given green.

  • Plant Types

  • Become familiar with the various types of plants; learn their behaviour and what they can offer each garden.

    Trees and shrubs create a garden backdrop for flowers. Choose pest and disease-resistant, high weather-tolerant plants.
    • Annuals: Live for single growing season, flowering or foliage only
    • Bulbs: Choose cold-hardy bulbs in autumn for flowers in spring
    • Perennials: Form the foundation of beds, filling it with a variety of colour, shape, texture and fragrance
    • Climbers/Vines: Cover walls and fences with foliage and flowers, annual or perennial
    • Grass: Choose varying blends of grass types to suit climate and light conditions
    • Trees: Offering magnificence and beauty, shade and shelter

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Plant Types

  • Become familiar with the various types of plants; learn their behaviour and what they can offer each garden.

    Trees and shrubs create a garden backdrop for flowers. Choose pest and disease-resistant, high weather-tolerant plants.
    • Annuals: Live for single growing season, flowering or foliage only
    • Bulbs: Choose cold-hardy bulbs in autumn for flowers in spring
    • Perennials: Form the foundation of beds, filling it with a variety of colour, shape, texture and fragrance
    • Climbers/Vines: Cover walls and fences with foliage and flowers, annual or perennial
    • Grass: Choose varying blends of grass types to suit climate and light conditions
    • Trees: Offering magnificence and beauty, shade and shelter

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Essential Watering

  • All plants need water to live and thrive, with the amount required being dependent on climate, soil quality, age, type, and the size of the plant.

    Most garden bed plants require an average of an inch of rain or equivalent supplement weekly, whereas potted plants require daily watering especially in hot weather.

    Once planted, water is given immediately. Infrequent deep watering is better than regular sprinklings; the best time is the morning as it reduces evaporation.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Conserve water by use of a rain barrel, soaker hoses or drip irrigation systems. The use of mulch is also excellent for water conservation.

  • Essential Watering

  • All plants need water to live and thrive, with the amount required being dependent on climate, soil quality, age, type, and the size of the plant.

    Most garden bed plants require an average of an inch of rain or equivalent supplement weekly, whereas potted plants require daily watering especially in hot weather.

    Once planted, water is given immediately. Infrequent deep watering is better than regular sprinklings; the best time is the morning as it reduces evaporation.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Conserve water by use of a rain barrel, soaker hoses or drip irrigation systems. The use of mulch is also excellent for water conservation.

  • Soil Nourishment

  • Gardening Tools

  • You will need to familiarize yourself with the wide array of garden tools and machinery available to make your job as a gardener easier and more efficient.

    These include sturdy shovel, hand trowel, garden fork, efficient cutters and pruners.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Gardening Tools

  • You will need to familiarize yourself with the wide array of garden tools and machinery available to make your job as a gardener easier and more efficient.

    These include sturdy shovel, hand trowel, garden fork, efficient cutters and pruners.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Pest and Disease Defense

  • Regular checking identifies potential problems.

    Know the symptoms of each disease and pest so you can treat it correctly. Problems can be caused by age, size, location, care, soil and weather; be familiar with symptoms and signs.

    Use the least toxic solution first; make a home-made pest repellent and use regularly.

    Keep your garden tidy and allow space between plants for sufficient air. Remove young weeds before they become a problem. Use mulch to keep them at bay.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Be proactive against garden pests with a mixture of repellent and barriers such as fencing, wire wrap or tree wrap.

  • Pest and Disease Defense

  • Regular checking identifies potential problems.

    Know the symptoms of each disease and pest so you can treat it correctly. Problems can be caused by age, size, location, care, soil and weather; be familiar with symptoms and signs.

    Use the least toxic solution first; make a home-made pest repellent and use regularly.

    Keep your garden tidy and allow space between plants for sufficient air. Remove young weeds before they become a problem. Use mulch to keep them at bay.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Be proactive against garden pests with a mixture of repellent and barriers such as fencing, wire wrap or tree wrap.

  • Introduction

  • For any business to be successful it is important to have clients or paying customers.
  • Without paying customers your business is not likely to succeed. You also need enough paying customers to make your business pay for itself and then some more, so that you, as the owner, have enough to meet your needs.

    In order to have enough customers, you first need to identify your customers, and then give them a reason to pay you instead of someone else, to work on their garden.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Typical Day - Introduction

  • You are in the gardening business presumably because you like the outdoors, nature and working with nature to create a beautiful and useful garden area.


  • If you do not like to have the sun on your back or see the birds and the flowers, then you seriously need to rethink your business.

    A typical gardener’s day is busy and full, completing the various chores that need to be done around a garden. From checking to picking, there is a lot of work involved in keeping a garden looking good and producing enough for a family to feed on.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • The following pages present a summary of what a regular day may look like. It is worth considering that the type of work you do on an average day will vary according to your customers’ needs, the season, the weather and any niche that you have chosen to specialize in.

  • Introduction

  • Gardening is a year-round job, with the nature of work varying with the changing seasons and from one month to another.

  • There are many tasks to do around the garden throughout the year.

    A professional gardener will have to deal with gardens that have a variety of plants, features and trees, each of which will need to be worked upon differently.

    We will take a look at the month by month jobs that need to be done around the garden.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Gardening Basics

  • The key points from this module are:
    • In this module you learned the basics of gardening, how to evaluate the soil and the requirements necessary to ensure it can provide the essential nutrients for plants to flourish.
    • You are now aware of the importance of planning a garden before setting a single seed, so you can determine what is required for soil improvement and drainage before choosing the plants.
    • You can be confident about purchasing the correct and healthy plants for sowing and have the knowledge to maintain the growth and health of the plants by use of compost, fertilizers and mulch.
    • With the insight to choose the right garden tools and be familiar with pest and disease control, you are ready to go further into the modules of this Garden Design & Maintenance Diploma Course.

    • You can be confident about purchasing the correct and healthy plants for sowing and have the knowledge to maintain the growth and health of the plants by use of compost, fertilizers and mulch.
    • With the insight to choose the right garden tools and be familiar with pest and disease control, you are ready to go further into the modules of this Garden Design & Maintenance Diploma Course.
